intro: Dortmanna ensifolia, commonly known as the swordleaf dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often medicinal properties. The plant features lanceolate, serrated leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, with a structure typical of the buckwheat family. Dortmanna ensifolia is often found in moist soils near streams, marshes, and other wetland habitats.
